whisper_hyp: दबा इतना बारी ता की में ल्से हिला नहीं सगा
mms_1b_hyp: तुम्हारे पास तीन महीने बच्चे हैं
mms_zs_constrained_hyp: दबा इतना भरी था। की में उसे हिला नम सके
omni_hyp: डबा इतنा भारी थا कि मैं उसे हिला नہीं सका
ref_dev: डब्बा इतना भारी था कि मैं उसे हिला नहीं सका।

llm_decision.raw:
डबा इतना भारी था कि मैं उसे हिला नहीं सका

CONFIDENCE: high  
REASONING: The hypothesis from OmniASR is the most grammatically correct and contextually coherent in Hindi. It accurately reflects the intended meaning of "it was so heavy that I couldn't move it." While the other systems have variations (e.g., "दबा", "भरी था", "ल्से हिला"), OmniASR uses proper Devanagari spelling, correct verb forms ("हिला नहीं सका"), and natural phrasing. The constrained zero-shot model has a similar idea but with incorrect or awkward phrasing ("की में उसे हिला नम सके" is nonsensical). Whisper and MMS-1B introduce unrelated or incorrect content. Thus, OmniASR's version is the most accurate and plausible.
